definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: Her shriek was dulled by the loud crash of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声在震耳的雷声中变得低沉了。

sentences.english: How quickly their shrieks of pain turn to enraptured adulation.
sentences.chinese: 它们痛苦的尖叫迅速转变成对吾等恩赐的狂热谄媚。

sentences.english: We all started screaming, and ran out of there fast.
sentences.chinese: 我们全部开始尖叫，并迅速撤离。

sentences.english: My skin crawled when I heard a sudden shriek in the dead of night.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚万籁俱寂时突然听到一声尖叫，吓得我汗毛直竖。

sentences.english: Josh and Zuleika hear the scream through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 杰克和奈提莉听到有尖叫声穿过树林。

sentences.english: And the "Scream" mask has become a classic Halloween costume.
sentences.chinese: “惊声尖叫”面具也成为经典万圣节装饰。

sentences.english: Dozens of Spanish beauties clamoured to get close to their idol.
sentences.chinese: 无数的西班牙美女顿时尖叫，拥过去接近她们的偶像。

sentences.english: I was aroused from my deep sleep by a loud scream.
sentences.chinese: 一声尖叫把我从熟睡中唤醒。

sentences.english: I was plagued with dreams of explosions and screaming.
sentences.chinese: 梦中的爆炸和尖叫声困扰着我。

sentences.english: Why didn’t you have the butcher cut off the end?
sentences.chinese: 他的悍妻尖叫，“你怎么不叫肉师傅把尾端给切掉？”

sentences.english: The woman's screams tore through the swirling snow.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人的尖叫声撕破盘旋的飞雪。

sentences.english: THE ORDER -----No looting in shops. No honking and no overtaking on the roads.
sentences.chinese: 商店没出现掠夺，路上也没追赶与尖叫。

sentences.english: A macaw screeched at him from its perch.
sentences.chinese: 一只金刚鹦鹉站在栖木上冲他尖叫。

sentences.english: "There were vases being broken and people climbing over other people and a lot of screaming," Bieber fan Taylor Inder told the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 到处都有花瓶被砸碎，人们相互拥挤着并大声尖叫。

sentences.english: We were afraid we'd have to up the voltage for a while, but he seems to have finally learned and the screams have lessened.
sentences.chinese: 现在他似乎终于学乖了一点，发出尖叫的次数也少了。

definition: to cry out in alarm or surprise
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
